options: Observing real users interacting with the product to identify issues
questions.explanation: Usability testing involves observing real users as they interact with a product to identify pain points, confusion, and areas for improvement in the user experience.

salesforce.title: Salesforce CRM Fundamentals Quiz
salesforce.description: Test your Salesforce customer relationship management knowledge

questions.question: What is Salesforce?
options: A cloud-based CRM (Customer Relationship Management) platform
questions.explanation: Salesforce is the world's leading cloud-based CRM platform that helps businesses manage customer relationships, sales, marketing, and service operations.

questions.question: What are the main Salesforce Clouds?
options: Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, Commerce Cloud
questions.explanation: Salesforce offers multiple clouds: Sales Cloud (sales automation), Service Cloud (customer support), Marketing Cloud (marketing automation), and Commerce Cloud (e-commerce).

questions.question: What is an Object in Salesforce?
options: A database table storing specific types of data (like Accounts, Contacts)
questions.explanation: Objects in Salesforce are database tables that store data. Standard objects include Account, Contact, Lead, Opportunity. Custom objects can be created for specific needs.

questions.question: What is Apex in Salesforce?
questions.explanation: Apex is Salesforce's proprietary, object-oriented programming language similar to Java, used to add custom business logic and create complex applications.

questions.question: What is Lightning Experience?
questions.explanation: Lightning Experience is Salesforce's modern UI framework offering improved productivity, customization, and user experience compared to Salesforce Classic.

questions.question: What is a Salesforce Workflow?
options: Automation tool to automate standard internal procedures
questions.explanation: Workflows automate standard processes by triggering actions (email alerts, field updates, tasks) based on specified criteria, streamlining business processes.

questions.question: What is Salesforce AppExchange?
options: Marketplace for Salesforce apps and integrations
questions.explanation: AppExchange is Salesforce's marketplace with thousands of pre-built apps, components, and consultants that extend Salesforce functionality.

questions.question: What is a Salesforce Record?
options: An individual instance of data within an object (like a specific customer account)
questions.explanation: A record is a single instance or row of data in an object. For example, 'Acme Corp' would be one record in the Account object.

questions.question: What are Salesforce Reports and Dashboards used for?
options: Visualizing and analyzing business data with charts and metrics
questions.explanation: Reports analyze Salesforce data with filters and formulas, while Dashboards display multiple reports visually with charts and metrics for quick insights.

questions.question: What is Salesforce Integration?
options: Connecting Salesforce with other systems and applications
questions.explanation: Salesforce Integration connects Salesforce with external systems (ERP, marketing tools, databases) using APIs, middleware, or native connectors for data synchronization.

data-science.title: Data Science Fundamentals Quiz
data-science.description: Test your data science, analytics, and machine learning knowledge

questions.question: What is Data Science?
options: Extracting insights from structured and unstructured data using scientific methods
questions.explanation: Data Science is an interdisciplinary field using scientific methods, algorithms, and systems to extract knowledge and insights from structured and unstructured data.

questions.question: What are the three main types of machine learning?
questions.explanation: Machine learning has three main types: Supervised (labeled data), Unsupervised (unlabeled data), and Reinforcement (learning through rewards/penalties).

questions.question: What is the difference between AI and Machine Learning?
options: AI is broader concept, ML is subset enabling machines to learn from data
questions.explanation: AI is the broad concept of machines performing tasks intelligently, while Machine Learning is a specific subset of AI focused on learning from data without explicit programming.

questions.question: What is 'overfitting' in machine learning?
options: Model learns training data too well, performs poorly on new data
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model learns training data patterns too well, including noise, resulting in poor performance on new, unseen data.

questions.question: What is a 'feature' in machine learning?
options: An individual measurable property or characteristic used as input
questions.explanation: Features are individual measurable properties or characteristics of data used as input variables for machine learning models (e.g., age, income, location).

questions.question: What is exploratory data analysis (EDA)?
options: Analyzing data to discover patterns, anomalies, and relationships
questions.explanation: EDA is the process of analyzing datasets to summarize characteristics, discover patterns, detect anomalies, and test hypotheses using visualization and statistical methods.

questions.question: Which Python library is primarily used for data manipulation?
questions.explanation: Pandas is the primary Python library for data manipulation and analysis, providing DataFrame structures and tools for cleaning, transforming, and analyzing data.

questions.question: What is cross-validation in machine learning?
options: Technique to assess model performance by splitting data into training/testing sets multiple times
questions.explanation: Cross-validation evaluates model performance by dividing data into multiple folds, training on some folds and testing on others, reducing overfitting and providing reliable performance estimates.

questions.question: What is the purpose of data normalization?
options: Scaling features to similar ranges to improve model performance
questions.explanation: Data normalization scales numerical features to similar ranges (often 0-1), preventing features with larger values from dominating model training and improving convergence.

questions.question: What is a confusion matrix?
options: A table showing classification model performance with true/false positives/negatives
questions.explanation: A confusion matrix visualizes classification model performance showing true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives for evaluating accuracy, precision, and recall.

data-analytics.title: Data Analytics Fundamentals Quiz
data-analytics.description: Test your data analysis and visualization knowledge

questions.question: What is Data Analytics?
options: Process of examining datasets to draw conclusions and support decision-making
questions.explanation: Data Analytics is the process of examining, cleaning, transforming, and modeling data to discover useful information, draw conclusions, and support decision-making.

questions.question: What are the four types of data analytics?
questions.explanation: The four types are: Descriptive (what happened), Diagnostic (why it happened), Predictive (what will happen), Prescriptive (what should be done).

questions.question: What is the difference between quantitative and qualitative data?
options: Quantitative is numerical, qualitative is descriptive/categorical
questions.explanation: Quantitative data is numerical and measurable (age, revenue), while qualitative data is descriptive and categorical (colors, opinions, feedback).

questions.question: What is a KPI (Key Performance Indicator)?
options: A measurable value showing effectiveness in achieving business objectives
questions.explanation: KPIs are measurable metrics that demonstrate how effectively a company is achieving key business objectives (e.g., sales growth, customer satisfaction).

questions.question: What is data cleansing/cleaning?
options: Identifying and correcting inaccurate, incomplete, or irrelevant data
questions.explanation: Data cleansing involves detecting and correcting corrupt, inaccurate, or irrelevant records, handling missing values, and removing duplicates to improve data quality.

questions.question: What is a pivot table?
options: A data summarization tool that aggregates and reorganizes data for analysis
questions.explanation: Pivot tables are powerful data summarization tools in Excel/spreadsheets that reorganize, sort, count, and total data to create meaningful summaries and insights.

questions.question: What is the purpose of data visualization?
options: Presenting data graphically to reveal patterns and insights quickly
questions.explanation: Data visualization uses charts, graphs, and visual elements to communicate data insights clearly, making complex data more accessible and understandable for decision-making.

questions.question: What is regression analysis?
options: Statistical method examining relationship between dependent and independent variables
questions.explanation: Regression analysis is a statistical technique that examines relationships between variables, predicting outcomes and identifying trends (e.g., sales vs. advertising spend).

questions.question: What does 'correlation' measure in data analytics?
options: The strength and direction of relationship between two variables
questions.explanation: Correlation measures the statistical relationship between two variables, ranging from -1 (perfect negative) to +1 (perfect positive), with 0 indicating no correlation.

questions.question: What is the difference between mean, median, and mode?
options: Mean is average, median is middle value, mode is most frequent value
questions.explanation: Mean is the arithmetic average, median is the middle value when sorted, and mode is the most frequently occurring value - each useful for different analytical purposes.

business-analytics.title: Business Analytics Fundamentals Quiz
business-analytics.description: Test your business intelligence and analytics knowledge

questions.question: What is Business Analytics?
options: Using data analysis to drive business decisions and strategy
questions.explanation: Business Analytics uses data, statistical analysis, and quantitative methods to gain insights, solve problems, and make informed strategic business decisions.

questions.question: What is the difference between Business Analytics and Business Intelligence?
options: BI focuses on historical data/reporting, BA includes predictive and prescriptive analysis
questions.explanation: Business Intelligence focuses on descriptive analytics (what happened), while Business Analytics extends to diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics for future planning.

questions.question: What is a dashboard in business analytics?
options: A visual display of key metrics and data points for monitoring performance
questions.explanation: A business dashboard is a visual interface displaying key performance indicators (KPIs), metrics, and data points in real-time for quick decision-making and monitoring.

questions.question: What is forecasting in business analytics?
options: Predicting future business trends and outcomes using historical data
questions.explanation: Forecasting uses historical data, statistical models, and trends to predict future business outcomes like sales, demand, revenue, and market trends.

questions.question: What is customer segmentation?
options: Grouping customers based on shared characteristics for targeted strategies
questions.explanation: Customer segmentation divides the customer base into distinct groups based on demographics, behavior, or preferences to create targeted marketing and service strategies.

questions.question: What is ROI (Return on Investment)?
options: A metric measuring profitability of an investment relative to its cost
questions.explanation: ROI measures the profitability of an investment, calculated as (Gain from Investment - Cost of Investment) / Cost of Investment, expressed as percentage.

questions.question: What is A/B testing in business analytics?
options: Comparing two versions to determine which performs better
questions.explanation: A/B testing compares two versions of a marketing element (email, webpage, ad) to determine which performs better based on conversion rates or other KPIs.

questions.question: What is churn rate?
options: The percentage of customers who stop using a product/service over time
questions.explanation: Churn rate measures the percentage of customers who discontinue their subscription or stop doing business with a company during a specific period.

questions.question: What is market basket analysis?
options: Analyzing purchase patterns to discover product associations
questions.explanation: Market basket analysis examines purchase patterns to identify products frequently bought together, helping optimize product placement, cross-selling, and promotions.

questions.question: What is cohort analysis?
options: Analyzing groups of users sharing common characteristics over time
questions.explanation: Cohort analysis groups users based on shared characteristics (signup date, acquisition channel) to track behavior patterns and metrics over time for better insights.

chatgpt-ai.title: ChatGPT & AI Fundamentals Quiz
chatgpt-ai.description: Test your ChatGPT and artificial intelligence knowledge

questions.question: What is ChatGPT?
options: An AI-powered conversational chatbot using large language models
questions.explanation: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot developed by OpenAI using large language models (LLM) trained on vast text data to generate human-like conversational responses.

questions.question: What does GPT stand for?
questions.explanation: GPT stands for Generative Pre-trained Transformer, a type of neural network architecture that uses transformers and is pre-trained on large datasets.

questions.question: What is a 'prompt' in ChatGPT?
options: The input text/question given to ChatGPT to generate a response
questions.explanation: A prompt is the input instruction, question, or text provided to ChatGPT that guides the AI to generate relevant and contextual responses.

questions.question: What is prompt engineering?
options: The skill of crafting effective prompts to get desired AI responses
questions.explanation: Prompt engineering is the practice of designing and refining input prompts to optimize AI output quality, accuracy, and relevance for specific tasks.

questions.question: What is Natural Language Processing (NLP)?
options: AI technology enabling computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language
questions.explanation: NLP is an AI field focused on interaction between computers and human language, enabling machines to read, understand, and generate text and speech.

questions.question: What are the limitations of ChatGPT?
options: Can produce incorrect info, lacks real-time data, potential bias, no true understanding
questions.explanation: ChatGPT can generate plausible but incorrect information, has knowledge cutoff dates, may reflect training data biases, and lacks genuine understanding or consciousness.

questions.question: What is the difference between AI and Machine Learning?
options: AI is broader concept, ML is subset where machines learn from data
questions.explanation: Artificial Intelligence is the broad field of creating intelligent machines, while Machine Learning is a specific subset enabling systems to learn and improve from experience.

questions.question: What is generative AI?
options: AI that creates new content (text, images, audio, video)
questions.explanation: Generative AI creates new original content (text, images, code, music) based on training data, examples include ChatGPT, DALL-E, and Midjourney.

questions.question: What is an API in the context of ChatGPT?
options: Application Programming Interface allowing apps to integrate ChatGPT functionality
questions.explanation: ChatGPT API is an interface allowing developers to integrate ChatGPT's capabilities into their applications, services, or products through programmatic access.

questions.question: What are tokens in ChatGPT?
options: Pieces of words used to process and generate text (roughly 4 chars per token)
questions.explanation: Tokens are chunks of text that language models process - roughly 4 characters or 0.75 words each. API usage and limits are measured in tokens.

core-hr.title: Core HR Fundamentals Quiz
core-hr.description: Test your core human resources management knowledge

questions.question: What is Human Resource Management (HRM)?
options: Strategic approach to managing people and workplace culture
questions.explanation: HRM is the strategic approach to effective management of people, encompassing recruitment, development, performance management, compensation, and employee relations.

questions.question: What are the main functions of HR?
options: Recruitment, Training, Performance Management, Compensation, Employee Relations
questions.explanation: HR functions include workforce planning, recruitment, onboarding, training & development, performance management, compensation, benefits, employee relations, and compliance.

questions.question: What is job analysis?
options: Systematic process of determining skills, duties, and knowledge required for a job
questions.explanation: Job analysis is the systematic process of gathering and analyzing information about job content, requirements, and context to create job descriptions and specifications.

questions.question: What is the difference between job description and job specification?
options: Job description outlines duties, job specification lists required qualifications
Job description is for managers only
questions.explanation: Job description details the duties, responsibilities, and scope of a position, while job specification outlines the qualifications, skills, and experience required.

questions.question: What is onboarding?
options: Process of integrating new employees into the organization
questions.explanation: Onboarding is the comprehensive process of integrating new hires into the organization, including orientation, training, socialization, and ensuring they become productive members.

questions.question: What is employee engagement?
options: Emotional commitment employees have toward organization and goals
questions.explanation: Employee engagement is the emotional commitment and connection employees feel toward their organization, leading to discretionary effort and improved performance.

questions.question: What is performance appraisal?
options: Systematic evaluation of employee job performance and productivity
questions.explanation: Performance appraisal is the systematic evaluation of employees' job performance, providing feedback, identifying development needs, and informing compensation and promotion decisions.

questions.question: What is organizational culture?
options: Shared values, beliefs, and practices that shape employee behavior
questions.explanation: Organizational culture encompasses the shared values, beliefs, attitudes, and practices that characterize an organization and influence how employees behave and interact.

questions.question: What is succession planning?
options: Identifying and developing employees for future leadership positions
questions.explanation: Succession planning identifies and develops internal talent to fill key leadership positions when they become vacant, ensuring business continuity and leadership pipeline.

questions.question: What is employee retention?
options: Organization's ability to keep employees and reduce turnover
questions.explanation: Employee retention refers to strategies and efforts to keep talented employees engaged and prevent them from leaving, reducing turnover costs and maintaining organizational knowledge.

hr-payroll.title: HR Payroll Processing Quiz
hr-payroll.description: Test your payroll processing and administration knowledge

questions.question: What is payroll processing?
options: Administrative task of compensating employees for work performed
questions.explanation: Payroll processing is the administration of employee compensation including calculating wages, withholding taxes and deductions, and distributing payments.

questions.question: What is the difference between gross pay and net pay?
options: Gross pay is total earnings, net pay is take-home after deductions
Gross pay is monthly, net pay is annual
questions.explanation: Gross pay is the total compensation before any deductions, while net pay (take-home pay) is the amount received after taxes, benefits, and other deductions.

questions.question: What are statutory deductions?
options: Legally mandated deductions like income tax, social security
questions.explanation: Statutory deductions are legally required withholdings from employee pay including income tax, social security contributions, Medicare, and other government-mandated deductions.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a payslip/paystub?
options: Document detailing earnings, deductions, and net pay for a pay period
questions.explanation: A payslip is a document provided to employees showing gross earnings, itemized deductions, taxes withheld, and net pay for a specific pay period.

questions.question: What are voluntary deductions?
options: Optional withholdings like retirement contributions, insurance premiums
questions.explanation: Voluntary deductions are optional withholdings employees authorize, including retirement plan contributions, health insurance premiums, life insurance, and charitable donations.

questions.question: What is overtime pay?
options: Additional compensation for hours worked beyond standard working hours
questions.explanation: Overtime pay is additional compensation (typically 1.5x or 2x regular rate) paid to non-exempt employees for hours worked beyond standard work hours as mandated by labor laws.

questions.question: What is payroll reconciliation?
options: Process of verifying payroll data matches accounting records
questions.explanation: Payroll reconciliation is the process of comparing payroll records with general ledger accounts to ensure accuracy, identify discrepancies, and maintain financial integrity.

questions.question: What is the purpose of payroll taxes?
options: Funding government programs like social security, Medicare, unemployment
questions.explanation: Payroll taxes fund government programs including Social Security, Medicare, unemployment insurance, and other social welfare programs, paid by employers and employees.

questions.question: What is direct deposit?
options: Electronic transfer of wages directly to employee's bank account
questions.explanation: Direct deposit is the electronic transfer of net pay directly into an employee's bank account, providing faster, more secure, and convenient payment delivery.

questions.question: What is a payroll cycle?
options: The recurring schedule for processing and paying employee wages
questions.explanation: A payroll cycle is the regular schedule for processing payroll (weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly, or monthly), determining how often employees are paid.

hr-management.title: HR Management & Strategy Quiz
hr-management.description: Test your HR management and strategic planning knowledge

questions.question: What is Strategic Human Resource Management (SHRM)?
options: Aligning HR practices with business strategy to achieve organizational goals
questions.explanation: SHRM integrates HR strategy with overall business strategy, ensuring HR practices support organizational objectives and create competitive advantage.

questions.question: What is workforce planning?
options: Strategic process ensuring right people, skills, and roles at right time
questions.explanation: Workforce planning analyzes current workforce, forecasts future needs, and develops strategies to ensure the organization has the talent required to achieve goals.

questions.question: What is talent management?
options: Integrated approach to attracting, developing, engaging, and retaining talent
questions.explanation: Talent management is a holistic approach encompassing recruitment, development, retention, succession planning, and performance management to optimize human capital.

questions.question: What is change management in HR?
options: Process of preparing and supporting individuals through organizational change
questions.explanation: Change management helps individuals, teams, and organizations transition from current state to desired future state, minimizing resistance and maximizing adoption.

questions.question: What is HR's role in organizational development?
options: Improving organizational effectiveness through planned interventions and strategies
questions.explanation: HR drives organizational development through strategic interventions including culture change, process improvement, leadership development, and capability building.

questions.question: What is diversity and inclusion in HR?
options: Creating workplace where all individuals feel valued and have equal opportunities
questions.explanation: Diversity and inclusion foster a workplace culture that values differences, ensures equitable treatment, and leverages diverse perspectives for innovation and performance.

questions.question: What is employee value proposition (EVP)?
options: Unique set of benefits and values offered to employees in exchange for skills
questions.explanation: EVP defines the unique value and experience employees receive in return for their contributions, differentiating the organization as an employer of choice.

questions.question: What is HR analytics/metrics?
options: Data-driven approach to measure and improve HR effectiveness
questions.explanation: HR analytics uses data and metrics (turnover rate, time-to-hire, engagement scores) to measure HR effectiveness, inform decisions, and demonstrate business impact.

questions.question: What is employer branding?
options: Managing organization's reputation as employer to attract and retain talent
questions.explanation: Employer branding shapes the organization's reputation as an employer, showcasing culture, values, and benefits to attract, engage, and retain top talent.

questions.question: What is competency-based HR management?
options: HR practices based on defined competencies required for job success
questions.explanation: Competency-based HR management aligns recruitment, development, and performance management around defined competencies (knowledge, skills, behaviors) required for success.

hr-generalist.title: HR Generalist Comprehensive Quiz
hr-generalist.description: Test your broad HR generalist knowledge across all HR functions

questions.question: What is the role of an HR Generalist?
options: Broad HR professional handling multiple HR functions
questions.explanation: HR Generalists are broad HR professionals managing multiple functions including recruitment, employee relations, compliance, benefits, training, and performance management.

questions.question: What is employee relations?
options: Managing relationships between employer and employees
questions.explanation: Employee relations involves managing the relationship between employer and employees, handling conflicts, maintaining positive workplace culture, and ensuring fair treatment.

questions.question: What is the purpose of an employee handbook?
options: Document outlining company policies, procedures, and expectations
questions.explanation: An employee handbook communicates company policies, procedures, expectations, benefits, and workplace rules, serving as a reference guide for employees.

questions.question: What is disciplinary action in HR?
options: Process of addressing employee misconduct or performance issues
questions.explanation: Disciplinary action is a formal process addressing employee misconduct or performance issues through progressive steps (verbal warning, written warning, suspension, termination).

questions.question: What is exit interview purpose?
options: Gathering feedback from departing employees to improve workplace
questions.explanation: Exit interviews gather honest feedback from leaving employees about their experience, reasons for departure, and suggestions for organizational improvement.

questions.question: What is workplace harassment?
options: Unwelcome conduct creating hostile or offensive work environment
questions.explanation: Workplace harassment is unwelcome conduct based on protected characteristics (gender, race, age) creating intimidating, hostile, or offensive work environment.

questions.question: What is HRIS (Human Resource Information System)?
options: Software system managing and automating HR processes and data
questions.explanation: HRIS is integrated software managing HR functions including payroll, benefits, recruitment, performance management, and employee records in a centralized system.

questions.question: What is the difference between termination and resignation?
options: Termination is employer-initiated, resignation is employee-initiated
questions.explanation: Termination is employer-initiated separation (voluntary/involuntary), while resignation is employee-initiated voluntary decision to leave the organization.

questions.question: What are employee benefits?
options: Non-wage compensation like health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off
questions.explanation: Employee benefits are non-wage compensation including health insurance, retirement plans, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, and other perks.

questions.question: What is HR compliance?
options: Adhering to employment laws, regulations, and industry standards
questions.explanation: HR compliance ensures the organization adheres to federal, state, and local employment laws, regulations, labor standards, and industry-specific requirements to avoid legal risks.
